result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnie L McAfee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. 
-Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: -To any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff 
 Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment, and/or counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

-Criminal Thinking Course. 
-If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: -20 hours community service to be completed as a condition of probation.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:10 a.m.
Attorney Andrea M Will in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Ronnie L McAfee.
Defendant Ronnie L McAfee appeared by video, in custody at MSDF.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read-in.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 2.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 2
Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  4 YEARS
Initial Confinement:  2 YEARS
Extended Supervision:  2 YEARS
Sentence is to run Consecutive to: any other sentence

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  3 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
Criminal Thinking
Perform 20 hours of Community Service

COSTS:  $268.00
DR GOD:  $10.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
. 
Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered;  filed by Atty. Mark Kershek
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 11:15 am.

3:10 PM   File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ronnie L McAfee in court by zoom with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Kershek requests a different date for plea/sentencing.  Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ronnie L McAfee
Current: PO Box 05911, c/o Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, Milwaukee, WI 53205-0911 United States  (Effective: 08-08-2022)
Prior: 5244 N  57th St, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

08:59 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronnie L McAfee in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  File not called on the record.  Attorney Kershek requests a date for plea and sentencing in about 60 days.  Court sets matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A/Gordie Boucher Ford listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.  Defendant may not use/possess any fake money.

08:52 AM Defendant Ronnie L McAfee in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.
